alert.note: Alert for Milwaukee (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 12 at 6:49AM CDT by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Wisconsin, including the following counties, Milwaukee and Waukesha. * WHEN...Until 900 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 648 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas have already caused minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 4 and 7 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Milwaukee, Waukesha, West Allis, Wauwatosa, Brookfield, Menomonee Falls, Whitefish Bay, Pewaukee, Brown Deer, Sussex, Hartland, Delafield, Fox Point, Elm Grove, Bayside, West Milwaukee, Glendale, Merton, Butler and River Hills. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
